question: Which of the following options best describes your child's current ability level?
options: Able to perform all activities of daily living or age appropriate milestones independently with no restriction
Able to participate in the following with some level of disability: ambulation, communication or fine motor tasks at an age appropriate level
Requires functional or equipment support for any of the following: ambulation, communication or fine motor tasks at an age-appropriate level
Dependent for all activities of daily living and unable to ambulate, communicate, or perform fine motor tasks at an age appropriate level even with support

question: If your child has cried today, how would you describe it?
options: Did not cry today OR was easily consolable after crying.
Excessive or high-pitched cry inconsolable for >2 minutes OR intermittently for < 10 minutes.
Excessive or high-pitched cry inconsolable for >2 minutes AND intermittently for < 10 minutes.
Excessive or high-pitched, not consolable (i.e. cried >10 minutes).

question: How would you describe your child's sleep last night?
Describe your child's current level of irritability.
options: Irritable, but calm in < 6 minutes after consoling.
Irritable, but calmed in 6-15 minutes by consoling.
Irritable, and calmed in >15 minutes or not at all.

question: How would you describe your child's startle reflex?
options: No startle reflex, or not observed.
Even stronger startle to noise involving face grimacing, blinking, and repeated arm jerking.
Startles even in the absense of noise.

question: Has your child experienced tremors - shaking, jittering, or shivering movements of the extremities that are not seizures - today?
options: Tremors only when disturbed (i.e. awoken from sleep, moved, or otherwise stimulated).

question: Have tone symptoms been observed today?
options: Increased or decreased muscle tone (i.e. excessive stiffness or floppiness).

question: Has your child experienced convulsions or seizures today?
Has your child had a fever today? Please provide today's morning temperature OR maximum temperature recorded over the past 24 hours, depending on which was higher.
Has your child experienced feeding difficulties today?
options: Poor feeding (i.e. infrequent or uncoordinated suck, or dependent on G-Tube feeds).

question: Has your child developed any of the following skin issues on his/her BODY.
options: Red patches that fade quickly when pressed with fingers.
Red patches that do NOT fade quickly when pressed with fingers.

question: Has your child developed any of the following skin issues on his/her HANDS, FACE, OR EARS.
options: Red patches that fade quickly when pressed with fingers.
Red patches that do NOT fade quickly when pressed with fingers.
